name: RabbitMQ
description: The RabbitMQ connector enables WSO2 Micro Integrator (MI) to publish messages and perform RPC interactions with a RabbitMQ broker. It supports reliable, asynchronous communication, allowing you to send messages to queues or exchanges, use the RPC pattern, and manage acknowledgments by accepting, discarding, or requeuing messages.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: queue
params.description: The name of the Queue.

params.name: queueType
params.description: Select the type of RabbitMQ queue to interact with: Classic, Quorum (for high availability), or Stream (for large, continuous message flows). Supported values: CLASSIC, QUORUM, STREAM

params.name: queueAutoDeclare
params.description: If enabled, the connector will attempt to declare the specified queue on the RabbitMQ server if it doesn't already exist.

params.name: exchange
params.description: The name of the exchange to bind the queue to. Leave empty to publish directly to the queue via default exchange.

params.name: exchangeType
params.description: The type of the RabbitMQ exchange: **DIRECT**, **FANOUT** (broadcast), **TOPIC** (wildcard routing), or **HEADERS** (attribute matching). Supported values: DIRECT, FANOUT, TOPIC, HEADERS

params.name: exchangeAutoDeclare
params.description: If enabled, the connector will attempt to declare the specified exchange on the RabbitMQ server if it doesn't already exist.

params.name: routingKey
params.description: Specify a routing key when binding a queue to a **DIRECT** or **TOPIC** exchange. If omitted, the queue name will be used as the routing key.

params.name: requestBodyType
params.description: Supported values: JSON, XML, TEXT

params.name: publisherConfirms
params.description: Enable publisher confirms to ensure message delivery acknowledgment from the RabbitMQ broker.

params.name: publishTimeout
params.description: The maximum time (in milliseconds) to wait for the message to be published before timing out.

params.name: queueArguments
params.description: Additional arguments (comma-separated key=value pairs) to use when declaring the queue, e.g., for setting policy attributes like message-ttl or max-length.

params.name: rabbitmq.classic.version
params.description: For Classic Queues, select the queue version (V1 or V2). V2 offers better performance and scale. Supported values: V1, V2

params.name: maxPriority
params.description: For Classic Queues: the maximum priority level the queue should support (0-255). Requires setting 'x-max-priority' in queue arguments.

params.name: initialMemberCount
params.description: For Quorum Queues: the initial number of replica nodes required for the queue.

params.name: deliveryLimit
params.description: For Quorum Queues: the maximum number of times a message can be redelivered to a consumer before being dead-lettered.

params.name: deadLetterStrategy
params.description: For Quorum Queues: defines the acknowledgment and redelivery behavior for failed messages. Supported values: AT_LEAST_ONCE, AT_MOST_ONCE

params.name: initialMemberCount
params.description: For STREAM queues: the initial number of stream members. Leave blank for default.

params.name: maxAge
params.description: For STREAM queues: the maximum retention time for stream data (e.g., '7d' for 7 days). Old messages will be discarded.

params.name: maxSegmentSize
params.description: For STREAM queues: the maximum size (in bytes) of a single segment file within the stream storage.

params.name: queueExclusive
params.description: If enabled, the queue will be deleted when the connection that declared it closes. Only one consumer can use an exclusive queue.

params.name: queueAutoDelete
params.description: If enabled, the queue will be automatically deleted when the last consumer disconnects from it.

params.name: queueOverflowStrategy
params.description: Defines what happens when a queue reaches its maximum length: **DROP_HEAD** (oldest messages are discarded), **REJECT_PUBLISH** (new messages are rejected), or **REJECT_PUBLISH_DLX** (rejected and sent to the Dead Letter Exchange). Supported values: DROP_HEAD, REJECT_PUBLISH, REJECT_PUBLISH_DLX

params.name: exchangeArguments
params.description: Additional arguments (as comma-separated key=value pairs) to use when declaring the exchange.

params.name: headerExchangeArguments
params.description: For **HEADERS** exchanges: set headers and values for the binding. Use `x-match=any` to match any header, or `x-match=all` to require all headers.

params.name: exchangeAutoDelete
params.description: If enabled, the exchange will be automatically deleted when the last queue is unbound from it.

params.name: requestCharSet
params.description: The content encoding/character set (e.g., UTF-8) used for the message body if the encoding/character set cannot be determined from the request message.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: replyToQueue
params.description: The name of the Reply-To Queue.

params.name: requestBodyType

params.name: requestTimeout
params.description: The maximum time (in milliseconds) to wait for sending the RPC request.

params.name: responseBodyType
params.description: Set the desired content type for the response if the content type cannot be determined from the RabbitMQ response message. Supported values: JSON, XML, TEXT

params.description: Additional arguments (comma-separated key=value pairs) to use when declaring the queue, e.g., for setting policy attributes like message-ttl or max-length.

Supported values: DROP_HEAD, REJECT_PUBLISH, REJECT_PUBLISH_DLX

params.name: replyToQueueArguments
params.description: Additional arguments (comma-separated key=value pairs) to use when declaring the queue, e.g., for setting policy attributes like message-ttl or max-length.

params.name: replyToQueueClassicVersion
params.description: For Classic Queues, select the queue version (V1 or V2). V2 offers better performance and scale. Supported values: V1, V2

params.name: replyToQueueMaxPriority
params.description: For Classic Queues: the maximum priority level the queue should support (0-255). Requires setting 'x-max-priority' in queue arguments.

params.name: replyToQueueInitialMemberCount

params.name: replyToQueueDeadLetterStrategy

params.description: For STREAM queues: the initial number of stream members. Leave blank for default.

params.name: replyToQueueMaxAge

Supported values: DROP_HEAD, REJECT_PUBLISH, REJECT_PUBLISH_DLX

params.name: requestCharSet
params.description: The content encoding/character set (e.g., UTF-8) used for the message body if the encoding/character set cannot be determined from the request message.

params.name: responseCharSet
params.description: The content encoding/character set (e.g., UTF-8) used for the message body if the encoding/character set cannot be determined from the response message.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: connectionName
params.description: The name for the rabbitmq connection

params.name: serverUrls
params.description: Enter RabbitMQ server URLs as a comma-separated list (e.g., host1:port1,host2:port2).

params.name: saslMechanism
params.description: Select the SASL mechanism to use for connection authentication. Supported values: PLAIN, EXTERNAL

params.name: oAuth2Enabled
params.description: Enable if using OAuth 2.0 (e.g., Client Credentials or Password Grant) for authentication instead of a simple username/password.

params.name: username
params.description: Username for PLAIN authentication.

params.name: password
params.description: Password for PLAIN authentication.

params.name: tokenEndpoint
params.description: Enter Identity Provider/Token Service token endpoint URL to generate the access token.

params.name: grantType
params.description: Select the grant type to use for token generation. Supported values: client_credentials, password

params.name: clientId
params.description: The client ID for token generation.

params.name: clientSecret
params.description: The client secret for token generation.

params.name: oAuth2UserName
params.description: Enter the username to use with password grant type for token generation.

params.name: oAuth2Password
params.description: Enter the password to use with password grant type for token generation

params.name: sslEnabled
params.description: Enable SSL/TLS for the RabbitMQ connection.

params.name: trustEverything
params.description: If enabled, all server certificates will be accepted, regardless of validity. **Not recommended for production environments.**

params.name: keyStoreLocation
params.description: The file path to the Keystore containing the client's private key and certificate.

params.name: keyStoreType
params.description: The type of the Keystore (e.g., JKS).

params.name: keyStorePassword
params.description: The password to access the Keystore.

params.name: trustStoreLocation
params.description: The file path to the Truststore containing trusted server certificates.

params.name: trustStoreType
params.description: The type of the Truststore (e.g., JKS).

params.name: trustStorePassword
params.description: The password to access the Truststore.

params.name: sslVersion
params.description: The preferred SSL/TLS protocol version (e.g., 'TLSv1.2', 'TLSv1.3').

params.name: hostnameVerificationEnabled
params.description: If enabled, the hostname in the server's certificate must match the server host name you are connecting to.

params.name: virtualHost
params.description: The virtual host (vhost) within the RabbitMQ server to connect to. Leave blank for the default '/' vhost.

params.name: connectionIdleTimeout
params.description: The maximum period (in milliseconds) the connection can remain idle without any activity before it is closed by the server.

params.name: connectionEstablishRetryCount
params.description: The number of times to retry establishing the connection to the RabbitMQ server. Leave blank for default.

params.name: connectionEstablishRetryInterval
params.description: The interval (in milliseconds) between retries when establishing the connection.

params.name: connectionRecoveryPolicyType
params.description: Defines the strategy for automatic connection recovery after a disconnection. Supported values: FIXED, FIXED_WITH_INITIAL_DELAY, FIXED_WITH_INITIAL_DELAY_AND_TIMEOUT

params.name: connectionRecoveryInitialDelay
params.description: The initial delay (in milliseconds) before the first recovery attempt starts.

params.name: connectionRecoveryInterval
params.description: The fixed interval (in milliseconds) between connection recovery retries.

params.name: connectionRecoveryTimeout
params.description: The total time (in milliseconds) allowed for the connection recovery process before giving up.
